column4: amd64 is hell to work with, I never thought it would be this bad even when people told me it would be worse... Now, is everyone going to complain about my speech or is someone going to try to be productive? [calrogman and Caliope so far have been the only two remotely helping me, and someone ran off Caliope]
you mean I can use a 32-bit install and save myself the headache?
why is it going to take half of my ram?
it seems to be my only option aside from returning to winblows...but i need ALL of my RAM in order to use the programs I need for school...
Just curious... have you looked into virtual machines?
: my school requires Winblows, i hate it, I was going to Virtual Machine that on my Linux so i don't have to maintain antivirus BS
Calrogman ; DVD iso is how I use my debian on the same flash drive [I store DVD 1 of the complete set, and run that like I would a Netinstall]
Calrogman: I know thats whay I want to VM the Winblows rather than my linux

With Debian[x86], I just Cat .iso > USB_Drive ... with Ubuntu i have cat .iso > USB_Drive [Result: isolinux.bin missing or corrupt], I have unetbootin [Result: isolinux.bin missing or corrupt] and I have pendriveinstaller [result: begin installation>Fail to detect networking hardware>Fail consecutive steps up to and including software install]
someone suggested that earleir and lost me
ok they just said to 'dd' and gave no instruction beyond that
will DD reformat the drive before installing?
just write over the existing file?
if you're trying to put a bootable linux on a USB, I suggest looking at the pendrivelinux site.
dsynders : I did pendriveinstaller earlier [result: begin installation>Fail to detect networking hardware>Fail consecutive steps up to and including software install]
ah... that sucks.  I've always had pretty good luck with the pendrivelinux stuff.
